column4: Now these [are] the names of the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , which came into Mitzrayim [Egypt - The Narrow Place] ; every man and his household came with Ya’akov [Heal of God].
Re’uven [Behold a Son] [Behold a Son] , Shim’on [he who hears] , Levi (Levite) [Adhesion, Joiner] , and Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised],
Yissakhar [There Is Recompense] , Z’vulun [Glorious Dwelling Place] , and Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength],
Dan [Judge] , and Naftali [My Wrestling] , Gad [Good Fortune with Troublesome Effort] , and Asher [Happy].
And all the souls that came out of the waist of Ya’akov [Heal of God] were seventy souls: for Yosef [(God) He Shall Add] was in Mitzrayim [Egypt - The Narrow Place] [already].
And Yosef [(God) He Shall Add] died, and all his brethren, and all that generation.
And the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] were fruitful, and increased abundantly, and multiplied, and waxed exceeding mighty; and the land was filled with them.
Now there arose up a new king over Mitzrayim [Egypt - The Narrow Place] , which knew not Yosef [(God) He Shall Add].
And he said unto his people, Behold, the people of the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] [are] more and mightier than we:

Come on, let us deal wisely with them; lest they multiply, and it come to pass, that, when there falls out any war, they join also unto our enemies, and fight against us, and [so] get them up out of the land.

Therefore they did set over them taskmasters to afflict them with their burdens. And they built for Par’oh [Pharaoh - Great House] treasure cities, Pitom [City of Justice] and Ra’amses [Child of the Sun].
But the more they afflicted them, the more they multiplied and grew. And they were grieved because of the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God].
And the Mitzri made the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] to serve with rigour:
And they made their lives bitter with hard bondage, in mortar, and in brick, and in all manner of service in the field: all their service, wherein they made them serve, [was] with rigour.
And the king of Mitzrayim [Egypt - The Narrow Place] spoke to the ‘Evri’ot [Hebrew] midwives, of which the name of the one [was] Shif’rah [Beautiful] , and the name of the other Puah [Splendid]:

And he said, When you 2f do the office of a midwife to the ‘Evri’ot [Hebrew] women, and see [them] upon the stools; if it [be] a son, then you 2f shall kill him: but if it [be] a daughter, then she shall live.
But the midwives feared God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] , and did not as the king of Mitzrayim [Egypt - The Narrow Place] commanded them, but saved the men children alive.
And the king of Mitzrayim [Egypt - The Narrow Place] called for the midwives, and said unto them, Why have you 2f done this thing, and have saved the men children alive?

And the midwives said unto Par’oh [Pharaoh - Great House] , Because the ‘Evri’ot [Hebrew] women [are] not as the Mitzri [Egyptian] women; for they [are] lively, and are delivered before the midwives come in unto them.
Therefore God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] dealt well with the midwives: and the people multiplied, and waxed very mighty.
And it came to pass, because the midwives feared God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] , that he made them houses.

And Par’oh [Pharaoh - Great House] charged all his people, saying, Khav’vah [Eve] (to breath, to live) every son that is born you 2f shall cast into the river, and every daughter you 2f shall save alive.
And there went a man of the house of Levi (Levite) [Adhesion, Joiner] , and took [to wife] a daughter of Levi (Levite) [Adhesion, Joiner].
And the woman conceived, and bore a son: and when she saw him that he [was a] goodly [child] , she hid him three months.
And when she could no longer hide him, she took for him an ark of bulrushes, and daubed it with slime and with pitch, and put the child in it; and she laid [it] in the flags by the river’s brink.
And his sister stood afar off, that is to say what would be done to him.

And the daughter of Par’oh [Pharaoh - Great House] came down to wash [herself] at the river; and her maidens walked along by the river’s side; and when she saw the ark among the flags, she sent her maid to fetch it.
And when she had opened [it] , she saw the child: and, behold, the babe wept. And she had compassion on him, and said, This [is one] of the ‘Evrim [Hebrew] children.

Then said his sister to Par’oh’s [Pharaoh - Great House] daughter, Shall I go and call to (to do entirely, do wholly) you i a nurse of the ‘Evri’ot [Hebrew] women, that she may nurse the child for you i?
And Par’oh’s [Pharaoh - Great House] daughter said to her, Go. And the maid went and called the child’s mother.
And Par’oh’s [Pharaoh - Great House] daughter said unto her, Take this child away, and nurse it for me, and I will give [you i ] your i wages. And the woman took the child, and nursed it.

And the child grew, and she brought him unto Par’oh’s [Pharaoh - Great House] daughter, and he became her son. And she called his name Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] : and she said, Because I drew him out of the water.

And it came to pass in those days, when Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] was grown, that he went out unto his brethren, and looked on their burdens: and he spied an Mitzri [Egyptian] attacking an ‘Evri’ot [Hebrew] , one of his brethren.
And he looked this way and that way, and when he saw that [there was] no man, he killed the Mitzri [Egyptian] , and hid him in the sand.
And when he went out the second day, behold, two men of the ‘Evri’ot [Hebrew] strove together: and he said to him that did the wrong, For what reason strike you i your i fellow?

And he said, Who made you i a prince and a judge over us? intend you i to kill me, as you i killed the Mitzri [Egyptian] ? And Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] feared, and said, Surely this thing is known.

Now when Par’oh [Pharaoh - Great House] heard this thing, he sought to slay Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] . But Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] fled from the face of Par’oh [Pharaoh - Great House] , and dwelt in the land of Midyan [Strife] : and he sat down by a well.
Now the priest of Midyan [Strife] had seven daughters: and they came and drew [water] , and filled the troughs to water their father’s flock.
And the shepherds came and drove them away: but Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] stood up and helped them, and watered their flock.
And when they came to Reu’el [Friend of God] their father, he said, How [is it that] you 2f are come so soon to day?
And they said, An Mitzri [Egyptian] delivered us out of the hand of the shepherds, and also drew [water] enough for us, and watered the flock.
And he said unto his daughters, And where [is] he? why [is] it [that] you 2f have left the man? call him, that he may eat bread.
And Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] was content to dwell with the man: and he gave Moshe his daughter.
And she bore [him] a son, and he called his name Gershom [Exiled One] : for he said, I have been a stranger in a strange land.

And it came to pass in process of time, that the king of Mitzrayim [Egypt - The Narrow Place] died: and the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] sighed by reason of the bondage, and they cried, and their cry came up unto God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] by reason of the bondage.

And God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] heard their groaning, and God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] remembered his covenant with Avraham [Exalted Father] , with Yitz’chak [Laughter] , and with Ya’akov [Heal of God].
And God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] looked upon the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , and God-Elōhīm [The Creator] had respect unto [them].

Now Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] kept the flock of Yitro [Excellence] his father in law, the priest of Midyan [Strife] : and he led the flock to the backside of the desert, and came to the mountain of God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered], [even] to Horev [Desert].

And the angel of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) appeared unto him in a flame of fire out of the midst of a bush: and he looked, and, behold, the bush burned with fire, and the bush [was] not consumed.
And Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] said, I will now turn aside, and see this great sight, why the bush is not burnt.

And when the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) saw that he turned aside to see, God-Elōhīm [The Living Word] called unto him out of the midst of the bush, and said, Moshe, Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] . And he said, Here [am] I.
And he said, Draw not near here: put off you i shoes from off you i feet, for the place whereon you i stand [is] holy ground.

Moreover he said, I [am] the God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] of your i father, the God-Elōhīm [The Powerful Living Word] of Avraham [Exalted Father] , the God-Elōhīm [The Powerful One] of Yitz’chak [Laughter] , and the God-Elōhīm [The Powerful Creator] of Ya’akov [Heal of God] . And Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] hid his face; for he was afraid to look upon God-Elōhīm [The Living Word].

And the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) said, I have surely seen the affliction of my people which [are] in Mitzrayim [Egypt - The Narrow Place] , and have heard their cry by reason of their taskmasters; for I know their sorrows;

And I am come down to deliver them out of the hand of the Mitzri, and to bring them up out of that land unto a good land and a large, unto a land flowing with milk and honey; unto the place of the Kena’ani [Merchant] , and the Hitti [Terrorists] , and the Emori [Highlanders] , and the P’rizi [Dwellers in Unwalled Towns] , and the Hivi [Villagers] , and the Y’vusi [Threshers, Trampled Under Foot].
Now therefore, behold, the cry of the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] is come unto me: and I have also seen the oppression which the Mitzri oppress them.

Come now therefore, and I will send you i unto Par’oh [Pharaoh - Great House] , that you i may bring forth my people the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] out of Mitzrayim [Egypt - The Narrow Place].

And Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] said unto God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] , Who [am] I, that I should go unto Par’oh [Pharaoh - Great House] , and that I should bring forth the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] out of Mitzrayim [Egypt - The Narrow Place]?

And he said, Certainly, I will be with you i ; and this [shall be] a token unto you i , that I have sent you i : When you i have brought forth the people out of Mitzrayim [Egypt - The Narrow Place] , you 2f shall serve God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] upon this mountain.

And Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] said unto God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] , Behold, [when] I come unto the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , and shall say unto them, The God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] of your fathers has sent me unto you; and they shall say to me, What [is] his name? what shall I say unto them?

And God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] said unto Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] : Ehyeh Asher Ehyeh [I am/will be what I am/will be] and he said, “Thus shall you i say unto the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] : ‘Ehyeh [I Am or I Will Be] …has sent me unto you.”

And God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] said moreover unto Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] , Thus shall you i say unto the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God]: [The Lord-Yehōvah] of your fathers, the God-Elōhīm [Creator] of Avraham [Exalted Father] , the God-Elōhīm [Creator] of Yitz’chak [Laughter] , and the God-Elōhīm [Creator] of Ya’akov [Heal of God] , has sent me unto you: this [is] my name forever, and this [is] my memorial unto all generations.

Go, and gather the elders of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] together, and say unto them, The Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] of your fathers, the God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] of Avraham [Exalted Father] , of Yitz’chak [Laughter] , and of Ya’akov [Heal of God] , appeared unto me, saying, I have surely visited you, and [seen] that which is done to you in Mitzrayim [Egypt - The Narrow Place]:

And I have said, I will bring you up out of the affliction of Mitzrayim [Egypt - The Narrow Place] unto the land of the Kena’ani [Merchant] , and the Hitti [Terrorists] , and the Emori [Highlanders] , and the P’rizi [Dwellers in Unwalled Towns] , and the Hivi [Villagers] , and the Y’vusi [Threshers, Trampled Under Foot] , unto a land flowing with milk and honey.

And they shall hearken to you i voice: and you i shall come, you i and the elders of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , unto the king of Mitzrayim [Egypt - The Narrow Place] , and you 2f shall say unto him, The Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) God-Elōhīm [The Living Word] of the ‘Evri’ot [Hebrews] has met with us: and now let us go, we beseech (to call upon; appeal; beg) you i , three days’ journey into the wilderness, that we may sacrifice to the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) our God-Elōhīm [The Living Word].
And I am sure that the king of Mitzrayim [Egypt - The Narrow Place] will not let you go, no, not by a mighty hand.
And I will stretch out my hand, and strike Mitzrayim [Egypt - The Narrow Place] with all my wonders which I will do in the midst thereof: and after that, he will let you go.
And I will give this people favour in the sight of the Mitzri: and it shall come to pass, that, when you 2f go, you 2f shall not go empty:

But every woman shall borrow of her neighbour, and of her that sojourns in her house, jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and clothing: and you 2f shall put [them] upon your sons, and upon your 2f daughters; and you 2f shall spoil (plunder; prey; booty) the Mitzri.

And Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] answered and said, But, behold, they will not believe me, nor hearken unto my voice: for they will say, The Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) has not appeared unto you i.
And the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) said unto him, What [is] that in you i hand? And he said, A rod.
And he said, Cast it on the ground. And he cast it on the ground, and it became a serpent; and Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] fled from before it.

And the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) said unto Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] , Put forth you i hand, and take it by the tail. And he put forth his hand, and caught it, and it became a rod in his hand:

That they may believe that the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] of their fathers, the God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] of Avraham [Exalted Father] , the God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] of Yitz’chak [Laughter] , and the God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] of Ya’akov [Heal of God] , has appeared unto you i.

And the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) said furthermore unto him, Put now you i hand into you i bosom. And he put his hand into his bosom: and when he took it out, behold, his hand [was] leprous as snow.
And he said, Put you i hand into you i bosom again. And he put his hand into his bosom again; and plucked it out of his bosom, and, behold, it was turned again as his [other] flesh.
And it shall come to pass, if they will not believe you i , neither hearken to the voice of the first sign, that they will believe the voice of the latter sign.

And it shall come to pass, if they will not believe also these two signs, neither hearken unto you i voice, that you i shall take of the water of the river, and pour [it] upon the dry [land] : and the water which you i take out of the river shall become blood upon the dry [land].

And Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] said unto the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , O my Lord-Adonai (The Father) [Lord Above All Things] , I [am] not eloquent, neither heretofore, nor since you i have spoken unto you i servant: but I [am] slow of speech, and of a slow tongue.
And the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) said unto him, Who has made man’s mouth? or who makes the dumb, or deaf, or the seeing, or the blind? have not I the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate)?
Now therefore go, and I will be with you i mouth, and teach you i what you i shall say.
And he said, O my Lord-Adonai (The Father) [Lord Above All Things] , send, I pray you i , by the hand [of him whom] you i will send.

And the anger of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) was kindled against Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] , and he said, [Is] not Aharon [Bright, Very High] the Levi (Levite) [Joined to] you i brother? I know that he can speak well. And also, behold, he comes forth to meet you i : and when he sees you i , he will be glad in his heart.
And you i shall speak unto him, and put words in his mouth: and I will be with you i mouth, and with his mouth, and will teach you what you 2f shall do.
And he shall be you i spokesman unto the people: and he shall be, [even] he shall be to you i instead of a mouth, and you i shall be to him instead of God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered].
And you i shall take this rod in you i hand, which you i shall do signs.

And Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] went and returned to Yitro [Excellence] his father in law, and said unto him, Let me go, I pray you i , and return unto my brethren which [are] in Mitzrayim [Egypt - The Narrow Place] , and see whether they be yet alive. And Yitro [Excellence] said to Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] , Go in peace.

And the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) said unto Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] in Midyan [Strife] , Go, return into Mitzrayim [Egypt - The Narrow Place] : for all the men are dead which sought you i life.

And Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] took his wife and his sons, and set them upon an ass, and he returned to the land of Mitzrayim [Egypt - The Narrow Place] : and Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] took the rod of God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] in his hand.

And the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) said unto Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] , When you i goes to return into Mitzrayim [Egypt - The Narrow Place] , see that you i do all those wonders before Par’oh [Pharaoh - Great House] , which I have put in you i hand: but I will harden his heart, that he shall not let the people go.
And you i shall say unto Par’oh [Pharaoh - Great House] , Thus says the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] [is] my son, [even] my firstborn:
And I say unto you i , Let my son go, that he may serve me: and if you i refuse to let him go, behold, I will slay you i son, [even] you i firstborn.
And it came to pass by the way in the inn, that the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) met him, and sought to kill him.
Then Zipporah took a sharp stone, and cut off the foreskin of her son, and cast [it] at his feet, and said, Surely a bloody husband [are] you i to me.
So he let him go: then she said, A bloody husband [you i are] , because of the circumcision.

And the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) said to Aharon [Bright, Very High] , Go into the wilderness to meet Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] . And he went, and met him in the mount of God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] , and kissed him.
And Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] told Aharon [Bright, Very High] all the words of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) who had sent him, and all the signs which he had commanded him.
And Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] and Aharon [Bright, Very High] went and gathered together all the elders of the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God]:

And Aharon [Bright, Very High] spoke all the words which the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) had spoken unto Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] , and did the signs in the sight of the people.

And the people believed: and when they heard that the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) had visited the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , and that he had looked upon their affliction, then they bowed their heads and worshipped.

And afterward Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] and Aharon [Bright, Very High] went in, and told Par’oh [Pharaoh - Great House] , Thus says the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , Let my people go, that they may hold a feast unto me in the wilderness.

And Par’oh [Pharaoh - Great House] said, Who [is] the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , that I should obey his voice to let Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] go? I know not the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , neither will I let Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] go.

And they said, The God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] of the ‘Evri’ot [Hebrew] has met with us: let us go, we pray you i , three days’ journey into the desert, and sacrifice unto the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) our God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] ; lest he fall upon us with pestilence, or with the sword.

And the king of Mitzrayim [Egypt - The Narrow Place] said unto them, For what reason do you 2f , Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] and Aharon [Bright, Very High] , let the people from their works? get you unto your burdens.
And Par’oh [Pharaoh - Great House] said, Behold, the people of the land now [are] many, and you 2f make them rest from their burdens.
And Par’oh [Pharaoh - Great House] commanded the same day the taskmasters of the people, and their officers, saying,
You 2f shall no more give the people straw to make brick, as heretofore: let them go and gather straw for themselves.

And the tale of the bricks, which they did make heretofore, you 2f shall lay upon them; you 2f shall not diminish [ought] thereof: for they [be] idle; therefore they cry, saying, Let us go [and] sacrifice to our God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered].
Let there more work be laid upon the men, that they may labour in it; and let them not regard vain words.
And the taskmasters of the people went out, and their officers, and they spoke to the people, saying, Thus says Par’oh [Pharaoh - Great House] , I will not give you straw.
Go you 2f , get you straw where you 2f can find it: yet none of your work shall be diminished.
So the people were scattered abroad throughout all the land of Mitzrayim [Egypt - The Narrow Place] to gather stubble instead of straw.
And the taskmasters hasted [them] , saying, Fulfill your works, [your] daily tasks, as when there was straw.

And the officers of the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , which Par’oh’s [Pharaoh - Great House] taskmasters had set over them, were beaten, [and] demanded, For what reason have you 2f not fulfilled your task in making brick both yesterday and today, as heretofore?
Then the officers of the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] came and cried unto Par’oh [Pharaoh - Great House] , saying, For what reason do you i deal thus with your i servants?
There is no straw given unto you i servants, and they say to us, Make brick: and, behold, you i servants [are] beaten; but the fault [is] in you i own people.
But he said, You 2f [are] idle, [you 2f are] idle: therefore you 2f say, Let us go [and] do sacrifice to the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate).
Go therefore now, [and] work; for there shall no straw be given you, yet shall you 2f deliver the tale of bricks.

And the officers of the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] did see [that] they [were] in evil [case] , after it was said, You 2f shall not diminish [ought] from your bricks of your daily task.
And they met Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] and Aharon [Bright, Very High] , who stood in the way, as they came forth from Par’oh [Pharaoh - Great House]:

And they said unto them, The Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) look upon you, and judge; because you 2f have made our savour to be abhorred in the eyes of Par’oh [Pharaoh - Great House] , and in the eyes of his servants, to put a sword in their hand to slay us.

And Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] returned unto the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , and said, Lord-Adonai (The Father) [Lord Above All Things] , wherefore have you i [so] evil entreated this people? why [is] it [that] you i have sent me?
For since I came to Par’oh [Pharaoh - Great House] to speak in you i name, he has done evil to this people; neither have you i delivered you i people at all.

Then the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) said unto Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] , Now shall you i see what I will do to Par’oh [Pharaoh - Great House] : for with a strong hand shall he let them go, and with a strong hand shall he drive them out of his land.
And God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] spoke unto Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] , and said unto him, I [am] the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate):

And I appeared unto Avraham [Exalted Father] , unto Yitz’chak [Laughter] , and unto Ya’akov [Heal of God] , by [the name of] El-Shaddai [God-The Powerful Living Word] , but by my name YEHOVAH was I not known to them.
And I have also established my covenant with them, to give them the land of Kena’an [Merchant] , the land of their pilgrimage, wherein they were strangers.

And they shall make an ark [of] shittim wood: two cubits and a half [shall be] the length thereof, and a cubit and a half the breadth thereof, and a cubit and a half the height thereof.
And you i shall overlay it with pure gold, within and without shall you i overlay it, and shall make upon it a crown of gold round about.
And you i shall cast four rings of gold for it, and put [them] in the four corners thereof; and two rings [shall be] in the one side of it, and two rings in the other side of it.
And you i shall make rods (clubs) [of] shittim wood, and overlay them with gold.
And you i shall put the rods (clubs) into the rings by the sides of the ark, that the ark may be borne with them.
The rods (clubs) shall be in the rings of the ark: they shall not be taken from it.
And you i shall put into the ark the testimony which I shall give you i.
And you i shall make a mercy seat [of] pure gold: two cubits and a half [shall be] the length thereof, and a cubit and a half the breadth thereof.
And you i shall make two cherubim [of] gold, [of] beaten work shall you i make them, in the two ends of the mercy seat.
And make one cherub [keruv] on the one end, and the other cherub [keruv] on the other end: [even] of the mercy seat shall you 2f make the cherubim on the two ends thereof.

And the cherubim shall stretch forth [their] wings on high, covering the mercy seat with their wings, and their faces [shall look] one to another; toward the mercy seat shall the faces of the cherubim be.
And you i shall put the mercy seat above upon the ark; and in the ark you i shall put the testimony that I shall give you i.

And there I will meet with you i , and I will commune with you i from above the mercy seat, from between the two cherubim which [are] upon the ark of the testimony, of all [things] which I will give you i in commandment unto the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God].
you i shall also make a table [of] shittim wood: two cubits [shall be] the length thereof, and a cubit the breadth thereof, and a cubit and a half the height thereof.
And you i shall overlay it with pure gold, and make thereto a crown of gold round about.
And you i shall make unto it a border of an hand breadth round about, and you i shall make a golden crown to the border thereof round about.
And you i shall make for it four rings of gold, and put the rings in the four corners that [are] on the four feet thereof.
Over against the border shall the rings be for places of the rods (clubs) to bear the table.
And you i shall make the rods (clubs) [of] shittim wood, and overlay them with gold, that the table may be borne with them.
And you i shall make the dishes thereof, and spoons thereof, and covers thereof, and bowls thereof, to cover withal: [of] pure gold shall you i make them.
And you i shall set upon the table showbread before me always.
And you i shall make a candlestick [of] pure gold: [of] beaten work shall the candlestick be made: his shaft, and his branches, his bowls, his knops, and his flowers, shall be of the same.
And six branches shall come out of the sides of it; three branches of the candlestick out of the one side, and three branches of the candlestick out of the other side:

Three bowls made like unto almonds, [with] a knob (flower bud) and a flower in one branch; and three bowls made like almonds in the other branch, [with] a knob (flower bud) and a flower: so in the six branches that come out of the candlestick.
And in the candlestick [shall be] four bowls made like unto almonds, [with] their knops and their flowers.

And [there shall be] a knob (flower bud) under two branches of the same, and a knob (flower bud) under two branches of the same, and a knob (flower bud) under two branches of the same, according to the six branches that proceed out of the candlestick.
Their knops and their branches shall be of the same: all it [shall be] one beaten work [of] pure gold.
And you i shall make the seven lamps thereof: and they shall light the lamps thereof, that they may give light over against it.
And the tongs thereof, and the snuff dishes thereof, [shall be of] pure gold.
[Of] a talent (weight of money; weight; gift) of pure gold shall he make it, with all these vessels.
And look that you i make [them] after their pattern, which was showed you i in the mount.
Moreover you i shall make the tabernacle [with] ten curtains [of] fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet: [with] cherubim of cunning work shall you i make them.
The length of one curtain [shall be] eight and twenty cubits, and the breadth of one curtain four cubits: and every one of the curtains shall have one measure.
The five curtains shall be coupled together one to another; and [other] five curtains [shall be] coupled one to another.

And you i shall make loops of blue upon the edge of the one curtain from the selvedge (fabric edge to prevent unraveling) in the coupling; and likewise shall you i make in the uttermost edge of [another] curtain, in the coupling of the second.
Fifty loops shall you i make in the one curtain, and fifty loops shall you i make in the edge of the curtain that [is] in the coupling of the second; that the loops may take hold one of another.
And you i shall make fifty hooks (fasteners) of gold, and couple the curtains together with the hooks (fasteners) : and it shall be one tabernacle.
And you i shall make curtains [of] goats’ [hair] to be a covering upon the tabernacle: eleven curtains shall you i make.
The length of one curtain [shall be] thirty cubits, and the breadth of one curtain four cubits: and the eleven curtains [shall be all] of one measure.
And you i shall couple five curtains by themselves, and six curtains by themselves, and shall double the sixth curtain in the forefront of the tabernacle.
And you i shall make fifty loops on the edge of the one curtain [that is] outmost in the coupling, and fifty loops in the edge of the curtain which couples the second.
And you i shall make fifty hooks (fasteners) of brass, and put the hooks (fasteners) into the loops, and couple the tent together, that it may be one.
And the remnant that remains of the curtains of the tent, the half curtain that remains, shall hang over the backside of the tabernacle.

And a cubit on the one side, and a cubit on the other side of that which remains in the length of the curtains of the tent, it shall hang over the sides of the tabernacle on this side and on that side, to cover it.
And you i shall make a covering for the tent [of] rams’ skins dyed red, and a covering above [of] badgers’ skins.
And you i shall make boards for the tabernacle [of] shittim wood standing up.
Ten cubits [shall be] the length of a board, and a cubit and a half [shall be] the breadth of one board.
Two tenons [shall there be] in one board, set in order one against another: thus shall you i make for all the boards of the tabernacle.
And you i shall make the boards for the tabernacle, twenty boards on the south side southward.
And you i shall make forty sockets of silver under the twenty boards; two sockets under one board for his two tenons, and two sockets under another board for his two tenons.
And for the second side of the tabernacle on the north side [there shall be] twenty boards:
And their forty sockets [of] silver; two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board.
And for the sides of the tabernacle westward you i shall make six boards.
And two boards shall you i make for the corners of the tabernacle in the two sides.
And they shall be coupled together beneath, and they shall be coupled together above the head of it unto one ring: thus shall it be for them both; they shall be for the two corners.
And they shall be eight boards, and their sockets [of] silver, sixteen sockets; two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board.
And you i shall make bars [of] shittim wood; five for the boards of the one side of the tabernacle,
And five bars for the boards of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the side of the tabernacle, for the two sides westward.
And the middle bar in the midst of the boards shall reach from end to end.
And you i shall overlay the boards with gold, and make their rings [of] gold [for] places for the bars: and you i shall overlay the bars with gold.
And you i shall rear up the tabernacle according to the fashion thereof which was showed you i in the mount.
And you i shall make a veil [of] blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen of cunning work: with cherubim shall it be made:
And you i shall hang it upon four pillars of shittim [wood] overlaid with gold: their hooks [shall be of] gold, upon the four sockets of silver.

And you i shall hang up the veil under the hooks (fasteners) , that you i may bring in there within the veil the ark of the testimony: and the veil shall divide unto you between the holy [place] and the most holy.
And you i shall put the mercy seat upon the ark of the testimony in the most holy [place].
And you i shall set the table without the veil, and the candlestick over against the table on the side of the tabernacle toward the south: and you i shall put the table on the north side.
And you i shall make an hanging for the door of the tent, [of] blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, wrought with needlework.
And you i shall make for the hanging five pillars [of] shittim [wood] , and overlay them with gold, [and] their hooks [shall be of] gold: and you i shall cast five sockets of brass for them.
And you i shall make an altar [of] shittim wood, five cubits long, and five cubits broad; the altar shall be Foursquare (squared; four cornered) : and the height thereof [shall be] three cubits.
And you i shall make the horns of it upon the four corners thereof: his horns shall be of the same: and you i shall overlay it with brass.
And you i shall make his pans to receive his ashes, and his shovels, and his basins, and his flesh hooks, and his fire pans: all the vessels thereof you i shall make [of] brass.
And you i shall make for it a grate of network [of] brass; and upon the net shall you i make four brazen rings in the four corners thereof.
And you i shall put it under the compass (go around, encircle; encompass) of the altar beneath, that the net may be even to the midst of the altar.
And you i shall make rods (clubs) for the altar, rods (clubs) [of] shittim wood, and overlay them with brass.
And the rods (clubs) shall be put into the rings, and the rods (clubs) shall be upon the two sides of the altar, to bear it.
Hollow with boards shall you i make it: as it was showed you i in the mount, so shall they make [it].
And you i shall make the court of the tabernacle: for the south side southward [there shall be] hangings for the court [of] fine twined linen of an hundred cubits long for one side:
And the twenty pillars thereof and their twenty sockets [shall be of] brass; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets [shall be of] silver.

And likewise for the north side in length [there shall be] hangings of an hundred [cubits] long, and his twenty pillars and their twenty sockets [of] brass; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets [of] silver.
And [for] the breadth of the court on the west side [shall be] hangings of fifty cubits: their pillars ten, and their sockets ten.
And the breadth of the court on the east side eastward [shall be] fifty cubits.
The hangings of one side [of the gate shall be] fifteen cubits: their pillars three, and their sockets three.
And on the other side [shall be] hangings fifteen [cubits] : their pillars three, and their sockets three.

And for the gate of the court [shall be] an hanging of twenty cubits, [of] blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, wrought with needlework: [and] their pillars [shall be] four, and their sockets four.
All the pillars round about the court [shall be] filleted with silver; their hooks [shall be of] silver, and their sockets [of] brass.
The length of the court [shall be] an hundred cubits, and the breadth fifty everywhere, and the height five cubits [of] fine twined linen, and their sockets [of] brass.
All the vessels of the tabernacle in all the service thereof, and all the pins thereof, and all the pins of the court, [shall be of] brass.
And you i shall command the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , that they bring you i pure oil olive beaten for the light, to cause the lamp to burn always.

In the tabernacle of the congregation without the veil, which [is] before the testimony, Aharon [Bright, Very High] and his sons shall order it from evening to morning before the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate): [it shall be] a statute forever unto their generations on the behalf of the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God].

And take you i unto you i Aharon [Bright, Very High] you i brother, and his sons with him, from among the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , that he may minister unto me in the priest’s office, [even] Aharon [Bright, Very High] , Nadav [Generous] and Avihu [he is my father] , El’azar [God has helped] and Itamar [Coast of Palms] , Aharon [Bright, Very High] ’s sons.
And you i shall make holy garments for Aharon [Bright, Very High] you i brother for glory and for beauty.

And you i shall speak unto all [that are] wise hearted, whom I have filled with the spirit of wisdom, that they may make Aharon [Bright, Very High] ’s garments to consecrate (treat as set apart or separate unto God) him, that he may minister unto me in the priest’s office.

And these [are] the garments which they shall make; a breastplate, and an ephod (vest) , and a robe, and a adorned with needlework coat, a mitre (turban; ceremonial headdress) , and a belt: and they shall make holy garments for Aharon [Bright, Very High] you i brother, and his sons, that he may minister unto me in the priest’s office.
And they shall take gold, and blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine linen.
And they shall make the ephod (vest) [of] gold, [of] blue, and [of] purple, [of] scarlet, and fine twined linen, with cunning work.
It shall have the two shoulder pieces thereof joined at the two edges thereof; and [so] it shall be joined together.

And the detailed (skillfully made) belt of the ephod (vest) , which [is] upon it, shall be of the same, according to the work thereof; [even of] gold, [of] blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen.
And you i shall take two onyx stones, and grave on them the names of the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God]:
Six of their names on one stone, and [the other] six names of the rest on the other stone, according to their birth.

With the work of an engraver in stone, [like] the engravings of a signet (seal or stamp) , shall you i engrave the two stones with the names of the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] : you i shall make them to be set in sockets of gold.

And you i shall put the two stones upon the shoulders of the ephod (vest) [for] stones of memorial unto the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] : and Aharon [Bright, Very High] shall bear their names before the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) upon his two shoulders for a memorial.
And you i shall make sockets [of] gold;
And two chains [of] pure gold at the ends; [of] wreathen work shall you i make them, and fasten the wreathen chains to the sockets.

And you i shall make the breastplate of judgment with cunning work; after the work of the ephod (vest) you i shall make it; [of] gold, [of] blue, and [of] purple, and [of] scarlet, and [of] fine twined linen, shall you i make it.
Foursquare (squared; four cornered) it shall be [being] doubled; a span [shall be] the length thereof, and a span [shall be] the breadth thereof.
And you i shall set in it settings of stones, [even] four rows of stones: [the first] row [shall be] a sardius, a topaz, and a Carbuncle (a red precious stone): [this shall be] the first row.
And the second row [shall be] an emerald, a sapphire, and a diamond.
And the third row a ligure, an agate, and an amethyst.
And the fourth row a beryl, and an onyx, and a jasper: they shall be set in gold in their inclosings.

And the stones shall be with the names of the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , twelve, according to their names, [like] the engravings of a signet (seal or stamp) ; every one with his name shall they be according to the twelve tribes.
And you i shall make upon the breastplate chains at the ends [of] wreathen work [of] pure gold.
And you i shall make upon the breastplate two rings of gold, and shall put the two rings on the two ends of the breastplate.
And you i shall put the two wreathen [chains] of gold in the two rings [which are] on the ends of the breastplate.
And [the other] two ends of the two wreathen [chains] you i shall fasten in the two sockets, and put [them] on the shoulder pieces of the ephod (vest) before it.
And you i shall make two rings of gold, and you i shall put them upon the two ends of the breastplate in the border thereof, which [is] in the side of the ephod (vest) inward.

And two [other] rings of gold you i shall make, and shall put them on the two sides of the ephod (vest) underneath, toward the forepart thereof, over against the [other] coupling thereof, above the detailed (skillfully made) belt of the ephod (vest).

And they shall bind the breastplate by the rings thereof unto the rings of the ephod (vest) with a lace of blue, that [it] may be above the detailed (skillfully made) belt of the ephod (vest) , and that the breastplate be not loosed from the ephod (vest).

And Aharon [Bright, Very High] shall bear the names of the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] in the breastplate of judgment upon his heart, when he goes in unto the holy [place] , for a memorial before the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) continually.

And you i shall put in the breastplate of judgment the Urim [Lights] and the Tumim [Perfection] ; and they shall be upon Aharon [Bright, Very High] ’s heart, when he goes in before the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) : and Aharon [Bright, Very High] shall bear the judgment of the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] upon his heart before the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) continually.
And you i shall make the robe of the ephod (vest) all [of] blue.

And there shall be an hole in the top of it, in the midst thereof: it shall have a binding of woven work round about the hole of it, as it were the hole of an habergeon (coat of mail for the neck and down) , that it be not rent.
And [beneath] upon the hem of it you i shall make pomegranates [of] blue, and [of] purple, and [of] scarlet, round about the hem thereof; and bells of gold between them round about:
A golden bell and a pomegranate, a golden bell and a pomegranate, upon the hem of the robe round about.

And it shall be upon Aharon [Bright, Very High] to minister: and his sound shall be heard when he goes in unto the holy [place] before the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , and when he comes out, that he die not.
And you i shall make a plate [of] pure gold, and grave upon it, [like] the engravings of a signet (seal or stamp) , HOLINESS TO THE Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate).
And you i shall put it on a blue lace, that it may be upon the mitre (turban; ceremonial headdress) ; upon the forefront of the mitre (turban; ceremonial headdress) it shall be.

And it shall be upon Aharon [Bright, Very High] ’s forehead, that Aharon [Bright, Very High] may bear the iniquity of the holy things, which the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] shall hallow (to approve, commend, accept) in all their holy gifts; and it shall be always upon his forehead, that they may be accepted before the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate).
And you i shall embroider the coat of fine linen, and you i shall make the mitre (turban; ceremonial headdress) [of] fine linen, and you i shall make the belt [of] needlework.
And for Aharon [Bright, Very High] ’s sons you i shall make coats, and you i shall make for them girdles, and bonnets shall you i make for them, for glory and for beauty.

And you i shall put them upon Aharon [Bright, Very High] you i brother, and his sons with him; and shall anoint them, and consecrate (treat as set apart or separate unto God) them, and sanctify (make holy; set apart for God’s use) them, that they may minister unto me in the priest’s office.
And you i shall make them linen trousers to cover their nakedness; from the waist even unto the thighs they shall reach:

And they shall be upon Aharon [Bright, Very High] , and upon his sons, when they come in unto the tabernacle of the congregation, or when they come near unto the altar to minister in the holy [place] ; that they bear not iniquity, and die: [it shall be] a statute forever unto him and his seed after him.
And this [is] the thing that you i shall do unto them to hallow (to approve, commend, accept) them, to minister unto me in the priest’s office: Take one young bullock, and two rams without blemish,
And unleavened bread, and cakes unleavened tempered with oil, and wafers unleavened anointed with oil: [of] wheaten flour shall you i make them.
And you i shall put them into one basket, and bring them in the basket, with the bullock and the two rams.
And Aharon [Bright, Very High] and his sons you i shall bring unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and shall wash them with water.

And you i shall take the garments, and put upon Aharon [Bright, Very High] the coat, and the robe of the ephod (vest) , and the ephod (vest) , and the breastplate, and gird him with the detailed (skillfully made) belt of the ephod (vest):
And you i shall put the mitre (turban; ceremonial headdress) upon his head, and put the holy crown upon the mitre (turban; ceremonial headdress).
Then shall you i take the anointing oil, and pour [it] upon his head, and anoint him.
And you i shall bring his sons, and put coats upon them.

And you i shall gird them with girdles, Aharon [Bright, Very High] and his sons, and put the bonnets on them: and the priest’s office shall be theirs for a perpetual statute: and you i shall consecrate (treat as set apart or separate unto God) Aharon [Bright, Very High] and his sons.
And you i shall cause a bullock to be brought before the tabernacle of the congregation: and Aharon [Bright, Very High] and his sons shall put their hands upon the head of the bullock.
And you i shall kill the bullock before the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate), [by] the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
And you i shall take of the blood of the bullock, and put [it] upon the horns of the altar with you i finger, and pour all the blood beside the bottom of the altar.

And you i shall take all the fat that covers the inwards, and the caul (membrane; fatty tissue around a bodily organ) [that is] above the liver, and the two kidneys, and the fat that [is] upon them, and burn [them] upon the altar.
But the flesh of the bullock, and his skin, and his dung, shall you i burn with fire without the camp: it [is] a sin offering.
you i shall also take one ram; and Aharon [Bright, Very High] and his sons shall put their hands upon the head of the ram.
And you i shall slay the ram, and you i shall take his blood, and sprinkle [it] round about upon the altar.
And you i shall cut the ram in pieces, and wash the inwards of him, and his legs, and put [them] unto his pieces, and unto his head.

And you i shall burn the whole ram upon the altar: it [is] a burnt offering unto the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) : it [is] a soothing aroma, an offering made by fire unto the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate).
And you i shall take the other ram; and Aharon [Bright, Very High] and his sons shall put their hands upon the head of the ram.

Then shall you i kill the ram, and take of his blood, and put [it] upon the tip of the right ear of Aharon [Bright, Very High] , and upon the tip of the right ear of his sons, and upon the thumb of their right hand, and upon the great toe of their right foot, and sprinkle the blood upon the altar round about.

And you i shall take of the blood that [is] upon the altar, and of the anointing oil, and sprinkle [it] upon Aharon [Bright, Very High] , and upon his garments, and upon his sons, and upon the garments of his sons with him: and he shall be consecrated, and his garments, and his sons, and his sons’ garments with him.

Also you i shall take of the ram the fat and the rump, and the fat that covers the inwards, and the caul (membrane; fatty tissue around a bodily organ) [above] the liver, and the two kidneys, and the fat that [is] upon them, and the right shoulder; for it [is] a ram of consecration:
And one loaf of bread, and one cake of oiled bread, and one wafer out of the basket of the unleavened bread that [is] before the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate):
And you i shall put all in the hands of Aharon [Bright, Very High] , and in the hands of his sons; and shall wave them [for] a wave offering before the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate).

And you i shall receive them of their hands, and burn [them] upon the altar for a burnt offering, for a soothing aroma before the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) : it [is] an offering made by fire unto the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate).

And you i shall take the breast of the ram of Aharon [Bright, Very High] ’s consecration, and wave it [for] a wave offering before the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) : and it shall be you i part.

And you i shall sanctify (make holy; set apart for God’s use) the breast of the wave offering, and the shoulder of the heave offering, which is waved, and which is heaved up, of the ram of the consecration, [even] of [that] which [is] for Aharon [Bright, Very High] , and of [that] which is for his sons:

And it shall be Aharon [Bright, Very High] ’s and his sons’ by a statute forever from the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] : for it [is] an heave offering: and it shall be an heave offering from the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] of the sacrifice of their peace offerings, [even] their heave offering unto the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate).
And the holy garments of Aharon [Bright, Very High] shall be his sons’ after him, to be anointed in it, and to be consecrated in them.
[And] that son that is priest in his stead shall put them on seven days, when he comes into the tabernacle of the congregation to minister in the holy [place].
And you i shall take the ram of the consecration, and seethe his flesh in the holy place.
And Aharon [Bright, Very High] and his sons shall eat the flesh of the ram, and the bread that [is] in the basket, [by] the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.

And they shall eat those things which the atonement was made, to consecrate (treat as set apart or separate unto God) [and] to sanctify (make holy; set apart for God’s use) them: but a stranger shall not eat [thereof] , because they [are] holy.
And if ought of the flesh of the consecrations, or of the bread, remain unto the morning, then you i shall burn the remainder with fire: it shall not be eaten, because it [is] holy.

And thus shall you i do unto Aharon [Bright, Very High] , and to his sons, according to all [things] which I have commanded you i : seven days shall you i consecrate (treat as set apart or separate unto God) them.

And you i shall offer every day a bullock [for] a sin offering for atonement: and you i shall cleanse the altar, when you i have made an atonement for it, and you i shall anoint it, to sanctify (make holy; set apart for God’s use) it.
Seven days you i shall make an atonement for the altar, and sanctify (make holy; set apart for God’s use) it; and it shall be an altar most holy: whatsoever touches the altar shall be holy.
Now this [is that] which you i shall offer upon the altar; two lambs of the first year day by day continually.
The one lamb you i shall offer in the morning; and the other lamb you i shall offer at even:
And with the one lamb a tenth deal of flour mingled with the fourth part of an hin [a quart] of beaten oil; and the fourth part of an hin [a quart] of wine [for] a drink offering.

And the other lamb you i shall offer at even, and shall do thereto according to the meat offering of the morning, and according to the drink offering thereof, for a soothing aroma, an offering made by fire unto the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate).

[This shall be] a continual burnt offering throughout your generations [at] the door of the tabernacle of the congregation before the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) : where I will meet you, to speak there unto you i.
